ul.li: FHIR Version: 4.0.0
Supported formats: xml, json
Published: 2019-05-28
Published by: HL7 International - US Realm Steering Committee

p.p: â€‹The Section describes the expected capabilities of the US Core Client which is responsible for creating and initiating the queries for information about an individual patient. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by US Core Servers are defined in the Conformance Requirements for Server. US Core Clients have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

ol.li: Support fetching and querying of one or more US Core profile(s), using the supported RESTful interactions and search parameters declared in the US Core Server CapabilityStatement.
See the [General Security Considerations] section for requirements and recommendations.

tr.td:
US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Report and Note exchange,
US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Laboratory Results Reporting
, patient+code, patient+category, patient+code+date, patient+category+date, patient+category+date, patient+category, patient+status
_id, patient, patient+type, patient+category+date, patient+type+period, patient+category, patient+status
_id, identifier, patient, class+patient, patient+type, date+patient, patient+status

US Core Smoking Status Observation Profile,
US Core Pediatric Weight for Height Observation Profile,
US Core Laboratory Result Observation Profile,
US Core Pediatric BMI for Age Observation Profile
_id, identifier, name, birthdate+name, gender+name, birthdate+family, family+gender

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core AllergyIntolerance Profile

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a AllergyIntolerance resource using:
GET [base]/AllergyIntolerance/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a CarePlan resource using:
GET [base]/CarePlan/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:

div.p:
Supported Profiles:

div.p:
Supported Profiles:

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Report and Note exchange,
US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Laboratory Results Reporting

ul.li: SHALL support createâ€ , search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support update, patch, delete, history-type.

div.blockquote:
createâ€
This conformance expectation applies only to the US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Report and Note exchange profile. The conformance expectation for the US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Laboratory Results Reporting is MAY.

ul.li:
A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a DiagnosticReport resource using:
GET [base]/DiagnosticReport/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core DocumentReference Profile

blockquote.p: The DocumentReference.type binding SHALL support at a minimum the 5 Common Clinical Notes and may extend to the full US Core DocumentReference Type Value Set

ul.li: SHALL support create, search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support update, patch, delete, history-type.

SHOULD support the $docref operation
A client SHOULD be capable of transacting a $docref operation and capable of receiving at least a reference to a generated CCD document, and MAY be able to receive other document types, if available. SHOULD be capable of receiving documents as included resources in response to the operation.
GET [base]/DocumentReference/$docref?patient=[id]

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a DocumentReference resource using:
GET [base]/DocumentReference/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core Encounter Profile

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a Encounter resource using:
GET [base]/Encounter/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core Goal Profile

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a Goal resource using:
GET [base]/Goal/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core Immunization Profile

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a Immunization resource using:
GET [base]/Immunization/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core Location Profile

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a Location resource using:
GET [base]/Location/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core Medication Profile

blockquote.p: The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using an external reference to a Medication resource. If an external Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria SHALL be supported.

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a Medication resource using:
GET [base]/Medication/[id]

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core MedicationRequest Profile

blockquote.p: The MedicationStatement resources can represent a medication using either a code or refer to the Medication resource. When referencing Medication, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application MAY choose any one way or more than one method, but if an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the _include` parameter for searching this element. The client application must support all methods.
For example, A server SHALL be capable of returning all medications for a patient using one of or both:

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a MedicationRequest resource using:
GET [base]/MedicationRequest/[id]

A Client SHOULD be capable of supporting the following _includes:
MedicationRequest:medication - GET [base]/MedicationRequest?[parameter=value]&_include=MedicationRequest:medication

div.p:
Supported Profiles:
US Core MedicationStatement Profile

blockquote.p: The MedicationStatement resources can represent a medication using either a code or refer to the Medication resource. When referencing Medication, the resource may be contained or an external resource. The server application MAY choose any one way or more than one method, but if an external reference to Medication is used, the server SHALL support the _include` parameter for searching this element. The client application must support all methods.
For example, A server SHALL be capable of returning all medications for a patient using one of or both:

ul.li: SHALL support search-type, read.
SHOULD support vread, history-instance.
MAY support create, update, patch, delete, history-type.

A Client SHALL be capable of fetching a MedicationStatement resource using:
GET [base]/MedicationStatement/[id]

A Client SHOULD be capable of supporting the following _includes:
MedicationStatement:medication - GET [base]/MedicationStatement?[parameter=value]&_include=MedicationStatement:medication

publisher.value: HL7 International - US Realm Steering Committee

description.value: ​The Section describes the expected capabilities of the US Core Client which is responsible for creating and initiating the queries for information about an individual patient. The complete list of FHIR profiles, RESTful operations, and search parameters supported by US Core Servers are defined in the [Conformance Requirements for Server](CapabilityStatement-us-core-server.html). US Core Clients have the option of choosing from this list to access necessary data based on their local use cases and other contextual requirements.

documentation.value:
The US Core Client **SHALL**:
1. Support fetching and querying of one or more US Core profile(s), using the supported RESTful interactions and search parameters declared in the US Core Server CapabilityStatement.

description.value: 1. See the [General Security Considerations] section for requirements and recommendations.

documentation.value: This conformance expectation applies **only** to the *US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Report and Note exchange* profile. The conformance expectation for the *US Core DiagnosticReport Profile for Laboratory Results Reporting* is **MAY**.

The DocumentReference.type binding SHALL support at a minimum the [5 Common Clinical Notes](ValueSet-us-core-clinical-note-type.html) and may extend to the full US Core DocumentReference Type Value Set

A client **SHOULD** be capable of transacting a $docref operation and capable of receiving at least a reference to a generated CCD document, and **MAY** be able to receive other document types, if available. **SHOULD** be capable of receiving documents as included resources in response to the operation.
`GET [base]/DocumentReference/$docref?patient=[id]`

The MedicationStatement and MedicationRequest resources can represent a medication, using an external reference to a Medication resource. If an external Medication Resource is used in a MedicationStatement or a MedicationRequest, then the READ and SEARCH Criteria **SHALL** be supported.

The MedicationStatement resources can represent a medication using either a code or refer to the Medication resource. When referencing Medication, the resource may be [contained](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#contained) or an external resource. The server application **MAY** choose any one way or more than one method, but if an external reference to Medication is used, the server **SHALL** support the _include` parameter for searching this element. The client application must support all methods.
For example, A server **SHALL** be capable of returning all medications for a patient using one of or both:
`GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]`
`GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]&_include=MedicationStatement:medication`

The MedicationStatement resources can represent a medication using either a code or refer to the Medication resource. When referencing Medication, the resource may be [contained](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/references.html#contained) or an external resource. The server application **MAY** choose any one way or more than one method, but if an external reference to Medication is used, the server **SHALL** support the _include` parameter for searching this element. The client application must support all methods.
For example, A server **SHALL** be capable of returning all medications for a patient using one of or both:
`GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]`
`GET /MedicationStatement?patient=[id]&_include=MedicationStatement:medication`
